If ever there were a game deserving of a little more variety it's Killing Floor. Every year we get new content in the form of character models, maps or tweaked weapons while the game itself remains entirely unchanged. An update to the AI so everything doesn't walk at you in a straight line, some type of objective beyond surviving waves, some other game modes possibly. Perhaps after seven years it's simply time for Killing Floor 2.
meh. ok but just get l4d2 though

Quite fun game, took a little while to get used to the engine and so on. Overall I like the idea of leveling up your playstyle and get bonuses that suit how you play. Haven't played enough to give a good review, but I like it and the only real concerns I have is that the AI may sometimes feel slightly stiff and I wonder how it will be once you level up more since the perks from levels give you quite an advantage once you level up. Probably got more difficult maps later on ;) Definitly recommended to play with friends, if you're alone you won't be able to get the most out of this game.

Killing Floor has some bad reviews. It also has some good reviews. But it mostly had reviews giving it 7/10, which is OK. If I were to give this game a rating, I'd say 8/10. It's a pretty good game. It is not like Left 4 Dead. There are numerous differences. For one, you don't rely on finding weapons lying around to gain arms. you go and buy it, which I think is not as good as finding random weapons, because the vendor moves every wave. Also, there's waves, instead of segment part things. And there's no storyline, or at least none that is obvious. I'm sure there are fan- created storylines for this game. Another difference this game has from Left 4 Dead is every weapon has ironsight. It's pretty cool.
It's really not scary enough to be a horror game, though more scary than Left 4 Dead. Well, not really scary, so much as startling. Espiecially in the Amusement Park map... I hated playing that. It was easy, but it was so eerie, I just don't want to play it again...
This game definately isn't for everyone. But if you loved Left 4 Dead, like I did, you will probably enjoy this game.
There are serveral different maps to choose from, but it seems they mainly relied on the community to make maps. And there are people on multiplayer, not a whole lot, but they're there. And, unlike Left 4 Dead, multiplayer isn't full of whiney little kids.

Killing Floor เป็นเกมที่อาศัยการร่วมมือกันเป็นทีม 6คนช่วยกันฆ่าศัตรู ตัวศัตรูจะมาเป็นระลอกครับ ระลอกสุดท้ายจะให้ช่วยกันฆ่าบอส ถ้าคุณชอบเล่นคนเดียวไม่แนะนำให้ซื้อครับเกมนี้เหมาะกับการเล่นหลายคนเท่านั้น ส่วนกราฟฟิคตัวเกมนั้นถือว่าตกยุคแล้วแต่ก็ยังมีคนเล่นอยู่ตลอดเพราะอะไรแนะนำให้เข้าไปลองครับ เพราะคุณไม่เคยเล่นเกมแนวนี้แน่นอน

Perks (หรือ Class) จะมีให้เลือก 7 Perks แต่ละ Perks จะมีปืนให้ใช้ความสามารถต่างๆกัน ตั้งแต่ 
-Sharpshooter เน้นใช้ปืนพกและปืนไรเฟิลแบบยิงได้ที่ละนัด เหมาะกับคนชอบยิงหัวศัตรูทำดาเมจแรงๆ
-Commando เน้นใช้ปืนกล เหมาะกับคนชอบวิ่งบู้ถือว่าเป็นอาชีพที่ธรรมดาที่สุดในเกมแล้ว
-Berserker เน้นการใช้อาวุธประชิดเป็นหลัก เป็นอาชีพที่ถึกและวิ่งไวที่สุดในเกม ถ้าเก็บเลเวลจนเลเวล 6แล้วถือว่าโหดมากทีเดียว
-Demolition เน้นการใช้ระเบิดเป็นหลัก ตั้งแต่ Grenade Launcher Rocket Launcher และ อีกหลายๆอย่างเหมาะกับการกวาดศัตรูที่อยู่เป็นกลุ่มๆในครั้งเดียว
-Firebug เน้นใช้ปืนไฟ หรือ ปืนกระสุนเพลิง เป็นอาชีพที่ค่อนข้างประหยัดกระสุนมากยิงนัดเดียวก็สามารถฆ่าศัตรูธรรมดาได้แล้ว
-Support specialist เน้นการใช้ Shotgun กับ ช่วยเชื่อมประตูกันศัตรูพังประตูเข้ามา
-Field Medic หมอช่วย Heal ลูกทีมค่อนข้างอึดเวลามีชุดเกราะ

Sometimes if you lose, a ''Rage'' may occur...

Just basically, a very enjoyable, co-op multiplayer zombie shooter. Light RPG meta-game element adds-in some progressive-grind, to keep you playing and feeling like you're working towards something. Nice, simple, and effective random bullet-time sequences spice up the 'feel' of gunplay during large encounters. Game has been out awhile now, and has had multiple weapon content additions, so there's plenty of variety in that area.

I could go on for awhile about the game, but what it really comes down to is simple : co-op shooters are not the most well-represented (in terms of number of available titles), and this one (in my opinion) pulls off all the basics right. It's not a complicated game, and there is no narrative to speak of... but it is just simply : fun to play. Try it. :)

Every glitch fixed promptly, new maps, new guns, new perks (classes) and a ton of holiday events.  These people care about their game and the people playing it and it bloody shows.  Can't wait for Kf2!

Killing Floor ... mas o que dizer ...não é andar a matar o chão, portanto tirem já o cavalinho da chuva xD
Bem, é um survival horror que pode ser jogado single player ou em coop até 6 pessoas (mais de 6 se fôr um server modificado) onde teem de sobreviver a diversas rondas de ZEDS (zombies/monstros) e na ultima ronda voçes teem de derrotar um boss ... existe jogos curtos, medios e longos, o que interfere no numero de rondas que a partida tem ...
7 diferentes classes, onde cada uma tem diversas vantagens e "habilidades, um arsenal de armas enorme, armas de corpo a corpo, pistolas, caçadeiras, assault rifles, rifles, armas alienigenas, explosivos .. e a lista vai indo ...
Graficos bons para a altura em que saiu, som das armas excelente, sente-se o coice das armas muito bem, jogo ainda bastante populado .. jogabilidade boa para o tipo de jogo que é .. para quem gosta de um bom survival horror em coop não se vai arrepender de ter este na coleção ;)

Killing floor est clairement LE jeu sur lequel j'ai littéralement explosé mon compteur de fou rire.
Le jeu est correct graphiquement, l'ambiance est bonne. Sa plus grande force reste son gameplay, extrêmement bon, et qui propose un énorme challenge. Hardcore ou casual gamers trouveront leur bonheur avec ce jeu.
Là où L4D2 se contente de foutre des vagues permanentes de zombies sans vraiment vous laisser le temps de souffler (ce qui, en plus d'être agaçant, vous donne l'impression de ne jamais avancer), Killing floor joue avec vos nerfs en vous proposant des phases de "trading" sans zombies (où il faudra acheter des armes, préparer le terrain) suivies de phases d'invasion de plus de 300 voir 400 monstres.
Et il s'agit bel et bien de véritables monstres, dont la simple vue vous ferra reculer à coup sûr.

Croyez moi, le Tank de L4D vous paraitra tout gentil comparé au Fleshpound de KF; Fleshpound qui apprécie la compagnie de ses congénères et qui n'hésitera pas à inviter des amis pour venir vous découper.
Une horde de Fleshpound ça fait peur.

Avec des amis, ce jeu est une bombe. Je n'ai jamais autant ri sur un jeu. Les situations comiques s'enchainent, on rigole sans arrêt. Surtout quand l'un de vos potes se voit poursuivi par une horde de Fleshpound et que vous ne pouvez rien faire pour le sauver.
Pierre, si tu me lis, sache que je me souviens très bien de la fois où tu t'es retrouvé enfermé dans 15 m² avec 3 fleshpound. Je n'avais jamais autant ri avant.

De plus, le jeu propose un nombre incalculable de map.
Bref, à posséder absolument.
